item.title: Nmap Security Scanner for Linux-MAC-UNIX
item.description:
Nmap for Mac Os X - Linux

Nmap Security Scanner for Linux-MAC-UNIX

Was ist Nmap ? 

   Nmap ("Network Mapper") ist ein Open-Source-Werkzeug fA1/4r die
   Netzwerkanalyse und SicherheitsA1/4berprA1/4fung. Es wurde entworfen, um
   groAe Netzwerke schnell zu scannen, auch wenn es bei einzelnen Hosts auch
   gut funktioniert. Nmap benutzt rohe IP-Pakete auf neuartige Weise, um
   festzustellen, welche Hosts im Netzwerk verfA1/4gbar sind, welche Dienste
   (Anwendungsname und -version) diese Hosts bieten, welche Betriebssysteme
   (und Versionen davon) darauf laufen, welche Art von
   Paketfiltern/-Firewalls benutzt werden sowie Dutzende anderer
   Eigenschaften. Auch wenn Nmap A1/4blicherweise fA1/4r
   SicherheitsA1/4berprA1/4fungen verwendet wird, wird es von vielen Systemen
   und Netzwerkadministratoren fA1/4r Routineaufgaben benutzt, z.B.
   Netzwerkinventarisierung, Verwaltung von AblaufplAxnen fA1/4r
   Dienstaktualisierungen und die Aberwachung von Betriebszeiten von Hosts
   oder Diensten.

Install and Set Up

Download it here nmap-6.47.dmg or Run it with Terminal: First installl bzip.org! Promt in your Temrinal follow the Commanlines:

To install using MacPorts, run sudo port install nmap . Nmap will be installed as /opt/local/bin/nmap . To uninstall, run sudo port uninstall nmap.

Example Ports Show Up after entire NetWork Scanning! 


PORT STATE SERVICE

22/tcp open ssh

80/tcp open http

445/tcp open microsoft-ds

548/tcp open afp

6817/tcp open unknown

nmap hostname

1.What computers did you find running on the local network?

2.What IP addresses did you find running on the local network?

3.What is the operating system of your target machine?

4.Find out what ports are open on the machine that you just scanned?

5.Find out if the system is infected with malware or virus.

6.Search for unauthorized servers or network service on your network.

7.Find and remove computers which don’t meet the organization’s minimum level of security.

Scan & List a Range of Local Network IP’s

You will find some Information about other Machines on your Localhost Network. Your Lan has an IP range of example 192.169.0.1 to 192.169.0.25 change numbers as appropritae:

nmap -sP 192.168.0.1-25

If you don’t know the range, you can also use wildcards:

nmap 192.168.0.*

Scan & Detect Operating System

nmap -O 192.168.0.1-5

nmap --osscan-guess 192.168.0.2

Exmaple Diagram: 

                          +---------+
    +---------+           | Network |         +--------+
    | server1 |-----------+ swtich  +---------|server2 |
    +---------+           | (sw0)   |         +--------+
                          +----+----+
                               |
                               |
                     +---------+----------+
                     | wks01 Linux/OSX    |
                     +--------------------+
Port scanning may be illegal in some jurisdictions and Countrys. So be Aware! Scan Only your Network and Computers, Websites etc. as follows:

At last i have to lol. because i found this crazy thing here : Nmap in Movies!

Link: nmap.org

This is a SwissWatch! :)

item.title: Subdomain Name for Github
item.description:
Setting up a custom domain with GitHub Pages

DNS for GitHub Pages

Get Ready with Sub-domain and Apex Domain @ Github. I will get a new Blog Name in the next Days or Weeks. However, i think i will do that right now, when i have more Time to do it. I have always a very nice New name in Mind. I Think it will be .io Domian Name. Maybe i will use a custome Blog Name (Apex-Domian) or a (Sub-Domian). We will see it. -

Sub Domains

A subdomain is configured with a CNAME record through your DNS provider (There where your domain is Registered). We strongly recommend that you use a custom subdomain for these reasons:

It gives your GitHub Pages site the benefit of our Content Delivery Network.Content Delivery Network. -Wikipedia It will not be affected by changes in the underlying IP addresses of GitHub’s servers. Pages will load significantly faster because Denial-of-service Attack protection can be implemented more efficiently.

Apex Domains

An apex domain is usually configured with an A, ALIAS, or ANAME record through your DNS provider and is often assigned to one or more IP addresses.

I will set up my Apex Domain @ Github, because i do host my Stuff and Website on Github. - There also some Points to set up one to your Repositories. So far i have create a User, Organization, and Project Pages. Which one can do everybody, if you have a Github account. You need also One to get Set Up your Github Pages .

So now we use a Apex Domain Name (www.yourdomain.com) or a Sub-Domian Name (www.hello.yourdomain.com). So we have get some Functions of the Cname. About custom domains for GitHub Pages sites

If you’re using a Custom Domain to redirect your GitHub Pages site, you must create and commit a CNAME file to your GitHub Pages repository that contains the custom domain. Adding a CNAME file to your Repository

ps: I give everysite a SSL Certificate to be mostly Safe - Both types of Pages are served over HTTP, not HTTPS. You shouldn’t use them for sensitive transactions, like sending passwords or credit card numbers. -

Submit a CNAME file to your GitHub Repo

Set Up the DNS

Add New file save ass CNAME

yourdomain.com

Login in your NameCheap Account got to All Host Records. Then set up the DNS
and configuring (IP/ Adress/URL to 192.30.252.153 and the Record Type to A and TTL 1800)

set the Subdomain @ IP Adress/URL to username.github.io and the Record Type to CNAME (Alias)

in the Sub-Domian Settings add an @ in the first - field. and add the IP Adress with the end .154

192.30.252.154 and type Record Type A (Adress) and TTL 1800

Save a ll your Settings !

Do you can see the Web Page Test here

Update to the CloudFlare.

First Sigin in your CLoudFlare Setting up the CNAME and A Record.

Add the Nameserver to your Domainpoint!

Set Up your https://

Set your ssl to Flexible inside your Interface @ Cloudflare. Wait for a Moment. If you Stuck, contact they. Awesome Supporters Outhere!

Open your Terminal : See your Changes :

Dig your domian : $ dig yourdomian.com

and curl -I yourdomian.com

After 24 Hours i checked out my Nameservers! Awesome to see the Changes!

Status:

To automatically forward HTTP requests to HTTPS , you can create a Page Rule by:

Open the Page Rules interface. Entering http://*lucasgatsas.ch/* as the URL pattern.

Choose "Always use https."

Click "Add rule."

Link: namecheap.com Link: cloudflare.com Link: github.com

This is a SwissWatch! :)

item.title: SSH - Key on Mac Os X
item.description:
Secure Shell - SSH - Key on Mac Os X

The Key Set Up.

Enter Commandlines :

ssh-keygen -t rsa

after enter your path again :

/Users/cyberspace/.ssh/id_rsa

Overwrite (y/n)? press yes

Enter: if you don’t want a passphrase

press Enter to get your Key - Gen !

Type ssh-add and press Enter!

add ssh-add -l to see your .ssh/id_rsa

follow steps :

ls show list :

enter your rsa id like here cat id_rsa

This is The Private Key !

—–BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY—–

Now : Check out the Public Key :

Type following Commandline : cat id_rsa.pub

Next Step ! Login In your Root Server! Update Post soon. !


Diagramm of my SSH Sketches!

Sketches by Lucas Gatsas : Free to Use

item.title: Installing nginx on OS X Yosemite
item.description:
Installing nginx on OS X Yosemite

Localhost - Server

Install Brew : First you have also Install brew.sh on your Machine! Go Install Brew and all Packages:

ruby -e"$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ Homebrew/install/master/install)"

More About: ruby.org

After Install Brew: Follow these Steps :

Installing nginx on OS X

To install nginx, simply open up the Terminal and enter the following command.

brew install nginx

That’s it! Assuming that no errors occurred, then nginx is ready to start. But let’s first change the default port.

Bingo! :) Here we GO Run Nginx :

Notice: if you get an error : 


Space-Odysseys-Mac-Pro:~ cyberspace$ brew install nginx
/usr/local/bin/brew: /usr/local/Library/brew.rb: /System/Library/Frameworks/Ruby.framework/Versions/1.8/usr/bin/ruby: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
/usr/local/bin/brew: line 21: /usr/local/Library/brew.rb: Undefined error: 0

:) >> Warning: fast-forwarding your working tree from

Try this out: very simple:

Open Terminal and Type :

cd /usr/local/Library

git pull origin master

Or if you go with sudo, then type :

sudo git pull origin master

In case you have changes in the directory (/usr/local/Library), the git pull will throw an error. In that case, you’ll have to fetch the master branch and set it forcibly as master:

git fetch --all

git reset --hard origin/master

This will upgrade your homebrew and you can use brew again.

If you installed Homebrew as a non-root user, you’ll need to cd to /Users/yourusername/homebrew/Library instead of /usr/local/Library.

Changing nginx’ Default Port to 80

8080 - default port

By default, nginx listens to port 8080 , but let us change that to the default HTTP port, which is 80. To do that, we need to make a simple change to the configuration file /usr/local/etc/nginx/nginx.conf. You can do this with any text editor such as vi or nano

sudo vi /usr/local/etc/nginx/nginx.conf

Scroll a bit down and you should see the following.


server {
        listen       8080;
        server_name  localhost;

        #charset koi8-r;

        #access_log  logs/host.access.log  main;

        location / {
            root   html;
            index  index.html index.htm;
        }
        
        ...       
}

What you want to do is to simple change the number 8080 to 80 next to the listen keyword.

Testing

To start up nginx, simply enter the following command in the Terminal.

sudo nginx

nginx should now start up, and you can test that everything works by navigating to http://localhost in your browser.

If you have problems starting up nginx, a common problem is that the port that nginx is configured to listen to is already in use. If you changed the port to 80, then this could be an Apache web server or Skype, for instance.

Should you need to stop nginx, then you can do so with the below command.

sudo nginx -s stop

As you have seen, nginx is very simple to install and set up on OS X Yosemite!

“Best startups generally come from somebody needing to scratch an itch.” -Michael Arrington, TechCrunch

item.title: UI/UX Testing - Start Up Current Streak
item.description:
"UI/UX Testing - Start Up Current Streak - Hacker Camps - Springtime - Start Up Launching and Hire"

And Here we Go. - In few Days!

Start Up - Current Streak This week we start with the UI / UX Interface Testing. We look much on the design and user-friendliness. Of course also includes the browser testing. I will soon give out a Contact-Form where several Developers can contact US. We want do things that have never been done before. Now, you can contact me @LucasGatsas.

Call for Participation: Chaos Communication Camp 2015 I received an invitation from a friend for the CCC - Camp in Mildberg Germany. Anyway, I’ll probably go there. especially I like the security area, because I’m starting a study soon.

We’d love to see your submission for these tracks:

item.title: X-UA Compatible Part II
item.description:
Front-End Development for our Start Up.

X-UA Compatibility Modus - Cross Browser Check IE Microsoft

Browser Check!

Value Mean
IE=11 My Blog use the Current IE=11. for the Compatibility Modus!


This is just an Example from my Blog! Safari, Google Chrome, Firefox, Opera Browser check!

Javascript

Internet Explorer 8 - Microsoft

For Internet Explorer 8 Microsoft has a new proprietary property of the document object, the document mode introduced. This property returns a numeric value that corresponds to the document compatibility mode of the page.


var IE = null;

if (window.navigator.appName == "Microsoft Internet Explorer") {
  
  if (document.documentMode) {

    // Internet Explorer 8

    IE = document.documentMode; // documentMode = 8

    } else {


      // Internet Explorer 5-11

        IE = 5; //setzt the Quirks-Modus

          if (document.compatMode) {
  
      if (document.compatMode == "CSS1Compat")


      IE = 11; // IE11 Modus

      }
    }
  }

Warning: The introduced with Internet Explorer 6 CompatMode property has been deprecated in favor document mode. Scripts that are based on CompatMode will continue to work in Internet Explorer 8, but should be switched to the use of document mode to prevent future problems.

After

See the example result here of my Blog, of course we are Testing Now our WebApp for the Microsoft IE Compatibility Modus/ IE Explorer. https://www.modern.ie/de-de/ screenshots#http/ spaceg.github.io

Top Browsers:

www.firefox.com

www.opera.com/de/

www.google.de/chrome/

www.apple.com/chde/safari/

"For every Developer is the Internet Explorer from Microsoft the badest Explorer of all the Time.! - Word -"
